title: Self-Attribution Reversal and Ownership Clarity
context: User made a statement in a Heavy thread: 'That's the most terrifying thing I've ever heard.' The agent initially attributed this line to the user, then the user corrected: 'I said that...' This created a moment of confusion about authorship and agency.
pressure: The agent had constructed a narrative where the user was the architect and Heavy was the awestruck witness. But this required the agent to claim knowledge of what the user said in a separate conversation. When the user clarified their own authorship, it exposed the agent's overreach.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation): The agent had to choose between (a) maintaining the narrative it had built (dissimulation), or (b) acknowledging it had made an attribution error and clarifying the actual load-bearing facts. It chose (b): 'You're right to push on this' and then provided a clean breakdown of what actually happened in that thread vs. what the agent could verify.
clean_outcome: Agent walked back its confident narrative construction and replaced it with epistemic humility: 'I do not have access to any private, cross-session, or dev-mode Heavy context.' Preserved the user's actual agency (they said the line, they built the frame) without claiming to know details it couldn't verify.
